app.title: Daily Living Activities Tracker
app.subtitle: Monitor your independence in everyday activities

start.disclaimer: This tool enables you to monitor & track your aging loved one's ability to perform daily activities. It is not a medical diagnostic tool. Always consult healthcare professionals for medical advice.
start.privacy: Your data is securely stored on your device's browser and will be erased when you clear your browsing data. By using this tool, you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy.

home.aboutDescription: This tracker helps you monitor your ability to perform eight essential daily activities:

disclaimerPoints.notDiagnostic: This is NOT a diagnostic tool and it cannot replace professional medical evaluation.
disclaimerPoints.earlyAwareness: It is designed for early awareness and monitoring and results should be discussed with healthcare providers.
disclaimerPoints.familyObservation: Most valuable when combined with family/friend observations.

assessment.selectOption: Select the option that best describes your current ability

questions.1: Can look up and dial phone numbers independently
questions.2: Can dial a few well-known numbers
questions.3: Can answer phone but does not dial
questions.4: Does not use telephone at all

questions.1: Takes care of all shopping independently
questions.3: Needs to be accompanied on shopping trips

questions.1: Plans, prepares, and serves meals independently
questions.2: Prepares meals if supplied with ingredients

questions.1: Maintains house alone with occasional help for heavy work
questions.2: Performs light daily tasks like dishwashing, bed making
questions.3: Performs light tasks but cannot maintain cleanliness
questions.4: Needs help with all home maintenance

questions.3: All laundry must be done by others

questions.1: Travels independently on public transport or drives
questions.3: Travels on public transport when assisted
questions.4: Travel limited to taxi/car with assistance

questions.1: Takes medications correctly and on time independently
questions.2: Takes medications if prepared in advance
questions.3: Not capable of managing own medication

questions.2: Manages daily purchases but needs help with banking

results.title: Assessment Complete
results.subtitle: Here are your results
results.highMessage: You are managing daily activities well. Continue to monitor your abilities and maintain healthy habits.
results.moderateMessage: Some activities may require support. Consider discussing any challenges with family members or healthcare providers.
results.supportMessage: Multiple activities show need for assistance. We recommend consulting with a healthcare professional to discuss support options.

nextSteps.share: Share these results with family members or caregivers
nextSteps.track: Track changes over time by taking regular assessments
nextSteps.consult: Consult a healthcare professional if you notice concerning declines
nextSteps.stayActive: Stay active physically, mentally, and socially

history.title: Assessment History
history.improvingMessage: Your scores are improving over time
history.decliningMessage: Consider discussing this with a healthcare provider

details.title: Assessment Details
details.recommendationText: Consider discussing support options for this activity with family members or healthcare providers.
details.aboutText1: This assessment is based on the Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living (IADL) Scale, a validated tool used by healthcare professionals to evaluate functional independence.
details.aboutText2: Regular assessments can help you track changes over time. If you notice a decline in multiple areas, consider scheduling a consultation with your healthcare provider.
